body: @mattfarina could you take an review? thanks so much.
Confirmed, seeing the same on the `darwin arm64` artifacts

We've temporary pinned 3.14.4 for GitHub Actions / Azure DevOps. Please drop a confirmation that it's expected behaviour for us to unlock updates of Helm. Thanks in advance.
- https://github.com/actions/runner-images/pull/9867
This is interesting because the both tags point to the same commit. When this was created, the release tag was added and CI did the build. So, how do we get CI to handle the tags properly?

If I look at the `build-cross` make target the version comes from ...

```
git describe --tags --abbrev=0 --exact-match 2>/dev/null
```

When I run this in Linux environments, I get the release version. I'm not able to duplicate it.

But, the wrong version shows up in the [release job](https://github.com/helm/helm/actions/runs/9102189102/job/25021198797) and the release job checkout out the exact right tag.

We need to update the build job (GHA workflow) to make sure the `VERSION` environment variable is the tag, I think?

Encountered this due to `ansible` within its helm modules throwing a `LooseVersion` error, downgraded to an older version of `helm` which reports `3.x.x` and things are happy again. The `-rc.2` didn't play nicely within Ansible, would be great to address this (through homebrew i don't encounter this `-rc.2` issue and get `3.15.0`)
Uhm isn't that even worse that homebrew ships a different binary?
@TheMeier this isn't unusual in open source.

repository.name: helmfile
repository.description: Declaratively deploy your Kubernetes manifests, Kustomize configs, and Charts as Helm releases. Generate all-in-one manifests for use with ArgoCD.

body: @TheMeier open source is about the source code rather than the builds. For example, pretty much everyone uses curl. The curl projects does not distribute binaries. Everyone gets them from their OS, package manager, etc. It's not just acceptable but expected to have different builds of the same source.

issue.title: Fixing build issue where wrong version is used

labels.name: size/XS
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 0-9 lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: picked
labels.description: Indicates that a PR has been cherry-picked into the next release candidate.

issue.body:
The release process had selected the tag to use as the version automatically. But, this presented a problem when a release candidate and final release pointed to the same commit id. For a long time it had automatically selected the final release. But, we ran into a problem where it selected the RC tag instead of the final release.

This change explicitly tells the build scripts the version to use based on the tag passed into the CI run. It should no longer try to self discover the version.

Closes #13040

2. If this PR closes another issue, add 'closes #<issue number>' somewhere in the PR summary. GitHub will automatically close that issue when this PR gets merged. Alternatively, adding 'refs #<issue number>' will not close the issue, but help provide the reviewer more context.-->

- [ ] this PR contains unit tests
- [x] this PR has been tested for backwards compatibility

body: The pull request at https://github.com/helm/helm/pull/13059 provides a simple fix. The tag is passed in as the explicit version rather than being automatically detected.
3.15.1 is out and it contains the proper version. Problem fixed.

issue.title: Revert "[Ubuntu] Pin Helm 3.14.4 due to unusual release of 3.15.0"
